appName: A Wanderer's Tale - Celebration of the Century
displayName: A Wanderer's Tale - Celebration of the Century
display_name: A Wanderer's Tale - Celebration of the Century
display_long_description:
A bush wanderer exploring the native Australian bushland is approached by a Cockatoo who kindly asks for the wanderer’s assistance. 

The protector of the area, a Crocodile, is turning 100 years old and all the local resident animals want to craft a ceremonial crown to present to her at the Celebration of a Century billabong gathering, before dusk.  

Unfortunately, the animals cannot do it in time without the wanderer’s help!

____________________________________________________


This software was developed through a research collaboration between QUT and Metro North Hospital and Health Service.

The game was an outcome of the project entitled “Co-design of an Innovative Virtual Reality (VR) Environment in Health: Engaging Burns Survivors and Adolescents and Young Adults (AYAs) with Cancer in the Management of Pain, Anxiety and Boredom through Distraction and Mindfulness”. 

The aim of the project being to engage patients in co-design with healthcare professionals and technology experts. This is to develop a VR environment to manage pain, anxiety and stress for adult burns survivors and adolescents and young adults with cancer. 

Developed by QUT (VISER - https://research.qut.edu.au/viser | https://vimeo.com/qutviser) in collaboration with Metro North Hospital and Health Service (https://metronorth.health.qld.gov.au)
